text: Sloan was our server, and he did a wonderful job, very attentive. The pizza was delicious, we had the Piemonte pizza.. definitely coming again

PLEASE TRY THIS PLACE!!! Stop going to the chain restaurants around Town Square and try something new, you won't be disappointed. Great service, great pizza, newly remodeled. Pizza is not greasy and everything tastes fresh. THIS IS NOT YOUR AVERAGE COOKIE CUTTER PIZZA, they have great combinations to try from. Try the cannoli for dessert, it's deconstructed and you make it how you like. Super yummy, definitely coming back!

Pizzas made to order and made delicious. We also started off by ordering the appetizer of fried calamari and shrimp. It was larger than I thought it would be and I thought it was a good choice for us to start with. 

I gave them a high 4 star for the combination of food choice, quality, and customer service... on this day there were on point. The customer service were attentive, friendly and made us feel like we weren't being rushed out. 

The restaurant tables and seating area was clean and lots of nice natural light with an option to sit outside on a patio. Which is nice being the restaurant sits on the second floor of Town Square.

People who visit Town Square are probably tempted to just go the California Pizza Kitchen as you enter in from Las Vegas Blvd due to it's prime and convenient location.  It's a shame, but those willing to walk a little bit into the shopping center and go up to the second level will find possibly the best pizza joint in the entire city.

La Bella Napoli has absolutely delicious Neapolitan-style pizza.  Tried the All You Can Eat lunch special for $13.85.  Every pie was delicious.  Really good quality mozzarella.  Probably the best Margherita I've ever had.

La Bella house salad was also delicious, nice candied walnuts and tasty parma ham.  Fresh greens and tangy balsamic vinegar that wasn't overpowering.  A nice complement to the pizza.

Tiramisu for desert was also spectacular, rich and creamy but not overly sweet like most I've had. 

Definitely will be back again, always nice finding another good Italian place here!

The most amazing pizza this side of Italy, and for sure the best pizza in LasVegas! Chef Dominick is so creative. Awesome pizza. Friendly and excellent service. Loved eating here. Can't wait to return.

Being Italian, I'm always up for a new Italian Restaurant to experience.  Last night I enjoyed a great meal and great service.  From being greeted and seated by the owner, to the friendly and pleasant server I felt like I was being welcomed into their family atmosphere.  My entree choice was pesto.  Served hot and filled with shrimp.  The Pesto was creamy and kept me happy bite after bite.  I'm in Las Vegas often for business and I think I just found my new favorite casual Italian restaurant!

Pizza was very good but the Australia open racchetta was even better.  The pasta, chicken Marsala were good.  The cannoli was very very good.  We came here several times and tried different pizza or pasta.  The service was good.  We recommended it to all our friends.

This place was exceptional!!!! First of all the best pizza in all of Las Vegas, we spent 5 years trying to find amazing pizza here!! All of the food is so extraordinary and the staff, each and every one including the owner and chef are so kind and accommodating!!! We seriously are in love with this place and are actually heading in a few hours and taking a bunch of friends:) don't miss out on this amazing place!!!!

I like to thanks everybody for accommodate us all the time with kindness and professionalism. We are in love with the pizza. This the best in town if you really like "original" Italian pizza. There are many way to make pizza if you been to Italy and you feel nostalgic Bella Napoli will definitely make you feel that you are back in the Amalfi coast.

service friendly but slow and inattentive
the drinks were good
the pasta was tasty but too much garlic we have a ravioli sugo and tagliatelle sugo
then we took Ortolana and Margharita waiting abaut 20 minutes to get to the table
the Ortolana was no taste, la Margharita was very watery 
this is not Italian food
will not came back again
Really good, authentic pizza. Nice ambience with some live music. Wished he'd played some more Sinatra and other 50s and 60s but maybe I was there at the wrong time.
Love this place! Upstairs best Blue Martini! Great staff. Nice vibing! Outdoor environment... Overlooks playground/stage area.

Naples in Vegas! Stopped here for lunch while walking through the Town Square shopping center. Prices are reasonable and food was great. It's a relaxed casual atmosphere. The staff was friendly and attentive. Would definitely eat here when in town. Pizza, wings and salad were delicious!

Here for vacation and stopped in to grab a. It's with the family. Excellent service and great portions! The food was delicious (had the linguini with clams). They've got a great wine list to compliment every meal as well. Would certainly recommend this spot for a nice relaxing dinner for anyone!

Great food and great service from Gerardo Meza.
the chicken wings with the pineapple and habanero sauce were one of the best I have had.
You must try the Porciini pizza, amazing taste with the wild mushrooms.
Great happy hour as well!!

The sauce they use in the pizza is heaven! It's messy and so delicious!

The staff is really friendly... maybe too friendly haha. I think the server came by a dozen times. Also the bartender came over once which felt odd. (Reason why only 4 stars).

Food came out fast and so fresh! It's a bit pricy! We had one pizza, a kid pizza and fettuccine alfredo (only water to drink) it came out to $45 not including the tip. I do wanna go back and try the desert it sounds really good!

Food was fantastic. But I recommend people to pay cash there. I paid the dinner with credit card. After a few days I noticed my card was charged more than I signed. Came to find out that some dishonest employee there altered my tip amount on the check, on top of 20% tip I wrote. I never had such an experience before, it made me think twice about paying with credit card in the future.

Are you kidding me? Sat at a table for 10 min not even approached by any of the servers. No water, no "hi, I'll be right with you", or nothing. Left the restaurant and no one even noticed-except the hostess who walked us to our table, who told us to have a nice night. *eyeroll* I really am disappointed Bc I wanted to try this place and had been waiting but due to the low quality service it will not be happening. CPK never disappoints and is literally a 3 minute walk
Great food. I tried the cheesy calzoni with salami with a sierra Nevada beer. Great combination.

Love the pizza and the meatballs.  The tomatoe sauce yummy and the polenta
Thank you so much.  Oh and my hand shaken piña colada are superb.
The food is great! Staff very friendly. Definitely must try it! We had the fritto calamari scampi for appetizer and it was probably the best we've had and the brick oven pizza, spectacular

Love the place and the pizza looks fantastic! So Italian! Will come back for sure! 
Great service as well. The waiter was very quick & kind. Everything was just perfect!

Stopped by before going to the airport. I was craving fettucini alfredo. The pasta came out piping hot and tasted delicious! It also came with a side of garlic bread. The service is very good and the setting is pretty romantic. The music is not too loud and I enjoyed my visit. I'll be coming back next time I'm in town :)

The pizza tastes just like the pizza I had in Italy. It brought back great memories...

The ingredients are fresh and high quality.

Linguini alla vongole was covered with so many big clams we couldn't even see the pasta underneath.
On a très bien mangé les pizzas s'ont copieuse et faite dans un four à bois ,accueil sympas pas beaucoup de mondes en semaine

Erica R.  Was amazing. Her personality was welcoming and I will only sit In her section. She spent time and was attentive. Slalom was quite pleasant and enjoyable as well. He informed us of of all the specials and activities that was happening all week. 
We will be back!

Great pizza, better waitress. 

Myself and a friend found this place at Town Square across from the movie theater on the 2nd level. It has a patio which overlooks the grass courtyard. 

I have yet to find pizza that compares to my childhood NY favorites but this ranks among the best in Las Vegas. It 's on par with Pizza Rock and is far better than Metro in my opinion. 

Personally I had a 4 cheese pizza with pineapples added and my friend had one with lots of meat. Do you ever find yourself eating a meal that is just too good to waste with idle chatter? You just dig in and don't allow for interruptions until you are done? This was that.  

Our service was also outstanding. The waitress was very friendly and helpful. She gave us the perfect amount of attention. Before we left she made us aware of all the weekly specials and invited us back. Given the great food and service, I plan to try out the pasta next week.

Just tried their four cheese pizza.....extremely bland, no flavour at all. A complete waste of $16 Read a few reviews now, and noticed others have had the same complain. For the price, the size, and quality I rather go to CPK or whole foods! Both have delicious pizza! I feel horrible because I forced my husband to try them over whole foods. 

3 stars, the crust is actually really good. If they can add some sauce and flavour it can be a good pizza

Daily Happy Hour 3pm-7pm menu posted.  4 delicious items for under $7.

Awesome service from 'Sloan' & VIP Yelp treatment.  The Baked Ham was similar to a Stromboli.  The nice arugula tang w/ fresh shaved Parmesan in the middle was wonderful, warm ham, melted ricotta, fresh mozzarella, Parmesan, olive oil & fresh basil.  During happy hour it is $5.92 or $6.40 after tax.  

Reminder to self, comeback the next four times to try:
Chicken Piccata $18.85 
The Chef Pizza $14.85
Aspargi Pizza $16.85
Calzone/pizza called a Rachettas, Miami Open looked fantastic!!  $16.85

Easy location across from Blue Martini, coed bathroom & very nice balcony overlooking the Christmas village going up.  

Halloween Walk in Town Square starting 7pm tomorrow so La Bella will have special Halloween drinks!  Very festive!

Not as good as I expected from an family passed recipes restaurant but still above average. Nice atmosphere and service. Crust does not have the true texture of an oven pizza, a little too soft for the crusty dough you would expect; nice choices of pizza toppings though .... What would make it worthwhile to come back is the live music with nice Brazilian music (owners are from Brazil) which puts a nice touch for a date...

Round two at La Bella Napoli was everything we expected! Tomato carpaccio to start with a perfect Burrata cheese! Not sure if it was made in house or not, but a generous portion of smooth creamy Burrata with perfectly ripe tomato...mmmmm :-) Caesar with just the right amount of well balanced dressing...tried the Quattro Formaggi pasta this time and it was a perfect balance of cheeses in a wonderfully textured sauce...I'm excited to go back and try the Rachetta pizzas :-)

We had the The Australian open and it was delicious!  The service is exceptional and the owner is very attentive.  You have to try this romantic restaurant!
Enjoy!

1st the view is nice. Especially in March when the weather is not too cold or not too warm. 

2nd the people who work there are adorable. They are here to make you happy 

3rd food is good as well as the price. Plus, we had a FREE tiramisu because we check-in on Yelp.

It's always disappointing when the quality doesn't match up with the price. We didn't have pizza, which is what they're known for, so keep that in mind. I had the chicken piccata for $23 & my daughter had the pasta w/ mushroom cream sauce for $20. Both were okay but not worth the price tag. Service was great & sitting on the patio was nice but Brio has better pasta dishes.

We visited last night for our first time! GREAT experience. The staff was SUPER friendly. The food was AMAZING. We will for sure be back. Thank you for the Sangria sample! Delicious! Will for sure be ordering that!

Took my better half  here for our standing Thursday night date night. We were not let down, the happy hour specials are just that special. We had the four cheese pizza and it was outstanding the best we have had in Las Vegas. They even had some live music too which was very cool. Our sever/bartender did a great job with making sure we had enough to drink and that the food was okay. Can't ask for more than that, we will be coming back here again.

To be fair, we only had drinks here, but I loved the staff!! Everyone was so eager to accommodate us and make sure our visit was great. Customer service goes a long way in my book and every single staff member we came across made it a point to see that all of our needs were taken care of.

The staff wasn't very friendly and our waiter, Raul, wasn't informative. We asked what pizzas he recommended and he said pepperoni and one other one with no description. We also asked what the rotolinis were and he gave us the wrong description. When we got them they weren't what we were expecting. It was like pulling teeth to get him to say anything. The soda was flat, I should have had a cocktail. The pizza was good and had flavor but I prefer Settebello or Due Forni. We paid our bill but Raul ended up charging our card for another person's bill so we had to get that sorted out. I kept both receipts in case he didn't properly void the first transaction. I really wanted to like this place but I won't be returning. Everything in that space at Town Square hasn't lasted long and service seems to be one of the biggest issues.

Bethany E went an entire YEAR without eating pizza for 2017. This impressive achievement meant I totally had to take her out for a noteworthy slice, and La Bella Napoli's unique raccheta pizzas fit the bill: they're shaped like a tennis racket with a cheese-filled handle and named after the tennis tournaments. We opted for the Australian, as that's what was playing, and it was the best combination of flavors from the other options we were eyeing, with yellow cherry tomatoes, parmesan, salami, buffalo mozz, basil, and olive oil. We also had their Fritto Calamari & Scampi app and shared La Bella salads, for a meal that left us absolutely stuffed.

The pizza was the highlight, with a great crust. As others have remarked, this is cut in an odd way with only two slices, so we had to hack and tear at it a bit. Flavors were solid though, would order another pizza in this style. The salads were super fresh and flavorful, with just the right amount of dressing that it was evenly distributed without being in a puddle. The surprise of our meal as the calamari app, which is a giant portion served in a giant martini glass, with a few shrimp thrown in. We could have easily shared this massive meal with a third person, but everything tasted so good we just couldn't stop eating!

Unimpressed. Came here in hopes of a quick bite to eat and left hungry. The hostess came outside the restaurant to convince us to come in as we were looking at the menu. When we got in there was maybe two other tables sat on a Saturday night - not a great sign. Now that we are actually seated the menu prices seem much more outrageous. We ordered a cheese pizza to share because we didn't want to pay 20+ dollars for anything else. The pizza was so tiny and thin when it came out. It was decent tasting at best. I gave one star for the cute patio area and another star for the free tiramisu you get while checking in. Also you do not get complimentary bread like a typical Italian restaurant!

We tried this place for the first time! We wanted brick oven pizza and searched the web this came ups Their fried shrimp and calamari, Hawaiian pizza and wings are simply delicious. Our waiter Urie provided us with great service by far the best service we've ever have.  Needless to say this place exceeded our expectations. We will definitely return!

Great pizza and fun patio environment, would definitely come back here. The interior is cozy and spacious as well. The patio has a great view and you might be lucky enough to catch some live music close by
What can I say, other than this is the best Italian restaurant in Vegas. Pizza, espresso, atmosphere, the best! 5 star well worth it

After a year long hiatus from pizza, Stefany V. wanted to meet up in Town Square to try one of their Rachetta pizzas.  Was it a good idea? Yes.

We met up during lunch time so it wasn't busy at all.  The service was good and attentive.  Our food was out very quickly.  Luckily for us we were ready to eat it up.  We started with the Fritto Calamari & Scampi appetizer.  This large and in charge app was great for sharing.  The calamari and shrimp were lightly battered.  The giant martini glass that is was served in made for a pleasant presentation.

I also tried the La Bella Salad.  This had great potential.  The ingredients of buffalo mozzarella, parma ham, cherry tomatoes & walnuts were indeed fresh but I felt it had a little too much balsamic vinegar for my taste.  Next time I would order the dressing on the side.

For the main event we shared the Australian Open Rachetta - a pizza with a handle!  I fell in love with the ingredients of mozzarella, arugula, basil, parma ham, tomatoes and parmesan.  The cherry on top had to be the stuffed handle filled with ricotta, provola and parmesan.  Great pizza. 

La Bella surely served up an Ace with their Rachettas.  I will be back to try another!

Food was delicious. That is the only positive thing I could say about this experience. Our party was seated all at 1230 waitress didn't take our order until 100. Everyone's food came out 1 by 1. We were there 2 hours we didn't get the last plate until 10 minutes before we left. We asked waitress for breadbasket there was a hair in the bread and when we let her know she said that it was ok it was on the napkin so it's ok. Manager came up to me asked how everything was. I told her why we were upset. He then said that it was ok that there was a hair on our bread. It seemed like they had no organization. Manager didn't seem to care.
Great relaxing atmosphere, our waitress was very knowledgeable. Had the chicken wings and they were perfectly crisp. The chicken Parmesan had the right amount of marinara sauce.

The food here is amazing. I had the pappardelle with short ribs. The pasta was incredibly fresh and the sauce was perfect. My wife had the veal marsala with polenta she loved it. And my sister had the branzino and it was cooked to perfection with a great olive based sauce. Then for dessert we had the deconstructed cannoli dish. Freaking amazing, loved it. A great dinner with a wonderful dish to finish it off. Super impressed by this place and thank you yelp for leading us here for dinner.

This is the best Pizzeria we have ever tried. It's off the strip and it definitely beats any restaurant that's on the strip. Another plus is it in the Town Square Plaza and it's so beautiful to sit out there and enjoy the best food.

We were in town Square on Mother's Day planning to catch lunch and an afternoon movie. Our first choice was Brio because we had eaten there many times before and they have patio seating. However there were no reservations available and at least a 30 minute wait to get in. We walked up to La Bella Napoli. We were able to get a reservation there for a table out on the patio. It was an absolutely gorgeous afternoon and the patio was a perfect setting with an absolutely lovely view. Rachel, our server, came by almost immediately to take our drink order.  Many of the yelp reviews raved about the pizzas but we decided To be a little bit more health-conscious and go with the salad rather than one of the specialty pizzas. The chef salad for $15 was huge and we were easily able to share. It was loaded with all of the usual ingredients of a chef salad. Delicious and filling.
We had a fantastic meal under the stars with friendly service and fantastic music by the lovely Patty Asher and her Samba & Jazz band!
Great food! My 2 year old loved the pasta and Alfredo sauce! The pepperoni pizza and baked ziti was really good too! We will definitely be back!

What a great way to end a trip to Vegas! This restaurant is very cozy with a great ambience. Live music and a giant wood fire oven from Italy . They happily pushed together tables to accommodate our large group of 14, mainly children, and brought out bread with oils to curve their beastly appetites. Children's menu is such a great Value. My kids pizzas were large enough to feed an adult. They loved the meatball with the French fries. Us adults grubbed on the Caesar , chicken Parmesan, & pepperoni pizza! Kids chicken tenders were a little over cooked and the Lemonade needed a little extra water  but nothing that we couldn't fix or that stopped us from enjoying our meal. You will definitely leave satisfied and with a touch of order envy as I was looking forward to coming back and getting things I saw on other tables!

I really liked the ambiance of this place. It's in a nice location on the second floor overlooking town square. There's indoor and outdoor seating. It's a small and sorta intimate restaurant. It's a nice place for a date night. 

They have a nice big pizza oven and you can see as they prepare the pizzas. Seems pretty authentic from what I saw and tasted. I wasn't crazy about the bread and olive oil. They bread tasted more stale than toasted. I'm not quite sure what they were going for. A baguette or crusty bread would have been nice. The menu had all sorts of pizzas and pastas that looked tempting and I want to try more next time. There was also a warm chocolate melting cake, my favorite! 

The service was great. Very friendly and quick.
I have been here twice so far. Wednesday nights are great with select bottles of wine half price and live entertainment. The pizza is great. And Geraldo is the best.
Great staff- great food. Love this place - excellent pizza and chk alfredo. Will be back
Staff Geraldo specifically, are Friendly, accommodating, welcoming, make you feel as if you are a part of their beautiful Italian familia! Great ambience, fantastic food
Went here with a group of 10 people and everybody LOVED the food. Service was amazing! This going on our favorite places to eat list for sure.

I have followed this place on social media for a while and I finally had the opportunity to go down there and check it out.  This place is absolutely fantastic.  My kids got kids pizzas and a meatball dish off of the kids menu while my wife and I ordered a Rachetta, (it's half pizza/half a calzone).  The taste and quality of everything was fantastic.  The dough had a smoky flavor to it as it just came out of the wood fired oven that was so enjoyable and I've never really tasted that before.  Heck, even the French fries that came with my daughters Meatball dish were high quality and unique.  The staff was courteous and very helpful as well.  I was looking for some garlic powder and the waitress brought out a cup of freshly minced garlic instead, which was awesome.
I plan on going back often and I would highly recommend his place to anyone.

It was the last thing we had, but I've gotta mention it first cuz that Tiramisu was INCREDIBLE! Perfect balance of rich dark chocolate, mixed with espresso, oh man - dream come true!

The salad and pizzas were also on point. But the show stealer out of the entrees had to be the gnocchi with pesto sauce, scrumptious! The pesto was an amazing blend of spices, and had the perfect nutty flavor. 

We were just strolling through the mall and decided to take the whole fam damily here and we are so glad we did! Amazing experience and the service was wonderful - very flexible, honest, and caring. 

Way to go La Bella Napoli!

I've been meaning to come here for a while and just never have so I decided to stop by here for Lunch last week and I was not disappointed one bit! My son got the kids pizza which was I'm assuming a 9" pizza and I got the chicken parm lunch special which was great! The portions are huge and although it was very slow at the time I'm hoping the business flows because I would hate to see it close. They have gluten free options and vegetarian options as well which is nice for some with dietary restrictions. Very fresh food and they even make their pasta from scratch! Christie did a good job and was social and attentive! Look forward to going back!
Great food and The Best Napoli Pizza! Service is fantastic bar tenders were great! So if you are in town square it's a must!

After trying to get a table at 3 different restaurants at town square and having to wait or not getting any service after sitting down for 10 mins we decided to try this place! Right away everyone was super nice and friendly. Got greeted by everyone including the bartender. Our served Erica was very nice and attentive. We had the pasta with  mushrooms and Alfredo sauce that was amazing and a pizza. Our favorite was the Nutella calzone stuffed with banana and strawberries. I would recommend this place and will be returning shortly.
This is mine and my wife's favorite Italian restaurant. The service is good, the food is very good, but the LaBella salad is fantastic! Very reasonable prices too!

One of the BEST kept secrets of TownSquare hands down, this is truly some amazing and authentic Italian pizza, I love the staff here and the vibe is awesome. So many great dishes you can choose from and it's like going to Italy, minus the airfare. The quality of food is UNBELIEVABLE. If you want pizza , prosciutto, fresh mozzarella like nowhere else you have to come here. I have been here a 100 times and the food is incredible
Came here after watching movie at AMC! Loved it very much. Cute place with nice views. Service was very fast and food was delish! Prices are reasonable!
Love this place.  So cute and great service.  The food is amazing and the atmosphere is very cute and really good food and not over priced.  Service was on point.

This restaurant is hands down one of the best Italian restaurants I have eaten in. Service at the bar was excellent. Food absolutely delicious.  Will definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking to indulge in excellent Italian food.

We celebrated my daughter's birthday here and it was an amazing experience. The fettuccine carbonara, fettuccine alfredo were awesome! The chef cooked it on top of a huge Parmesan cheese. The fritto calamari was perfect!  The chef was really friendly and our server Laurel was terrific; she did her best to check on us frequently! You guys rock!

Wow!! Some of the best pizza I have ever had.The Dominique is just the right amount of sweet and Spicy and my son loved the hotdogs pizza with fries.THe Calamari is crispy and taste homemade not frozen. I love the sweet chilli sauce. Some of the best Sangria I ever Had. If you stop in have Paulo make one of his special cocktails. He is an Amazing Bartender! GREAT Food Great Service you can't go wrong!

I ordered postmates carryout from here so the pizza was a little cold but my soup was delicious and homemade.  I've eaten at the restaurant too and the pizza is like no other here in Vegas.  You can taste the quality.  Their arugula salad dressing was to die for!! Love this place. Do you guys have happy hour specials?

Everything about this place was great! 

The vibe was romantic, the patio had heaters and little twinkle lights. The service was so great. Our server was so attentive and helped us decide what to eat. 

We had pasta and pizza and it was obvious that they were made in house. The pizza was so freaking good and the pasta was even better. 


I can't wait to go back!

We used to come here when this was an Irish place. Unfortunately it seems we were the only ones to eat here lol. 
Now that its la bella napoli it's much busier, vibrant and fun. They treated us like kings with fantastic service. Our waiter Sloan went above and beyond. It was the perfect time of year to sit outside on the 2nd story patio overlooking the main park area and Tommy Bahamas.
Sloan recommend some dishes that sound anazing. Can't wait to come back here and try them in the near future. 
Tonight we had the baked ham which was a lil finger sandwich. Really good for 2 people.
Pizza....really good! They were out of like 3 items we wanted. Pricing is more like 3 stars. I would go back for the pizza.

This restaurant is a bit hard to find. It is across from the entrance to the AMC Theater on the second floor. The AMC is at the western edge of the Town Square Shopping Center.  Google maps can be a bit confusing.

The service, atmosphere, and food were fine.  The happy hour wine prices were OK. My partner suggested that the served wine was old and had been opened a while.

My issue is that a not very strong double scotch/rocks cost $22. The server suggested the double. I asked the server about the price on the ticket and got sort of a shrug. I think this is gouging to the max. 

If you are careful about ordering and ask for the prices on everything before ordering, a pleasant time can be experienced.

We don't intend to return. There are a number of other restaurants in that area that are probably  good and a much better value.

Friends and I went to see a movie at Town Square and before the previews started, a commercial for La Bella Napoli and it looked delicious.

Post movie munchies were in full effect so we headed across the walk way to La Bella Napoli (located in the same location as the old English gastro pub). Bonus: if you bring your movie stub in and present it to the wait staff you receive 10% off of your bill).

The wood fired pizza was delicious and they have a killer all you can eat lunch special for under $14.00.  Sangria pitcher was a bit pricey at $40.00 but all in all it was a delicious new adventure this Wednesday afternoon post-movie.

We will definitely be repeat offenders at this carb-tastic establishment.

We went for Lunch and used the BOGO offer that was delivered to my place of employment. Please make sure to read the fine print as the coupon they deliver is not the coupon you have to logon to a website to obtain the actual coupon.

When we arrived we were greeted and seated promptly!! The waitress asked us if we were told about a pizza sampler explained it then took our drink orders, she came back with our drinks and then took our order. As we were waiting for our food which was served rather quickly much appreciated since we were on our lunch break... we heard another waitress telling the table next to us about the specials so when our server came back to the table with the bread( which was a bit on the older stale side) we asked oh could you tell us about the daily special she started with the price so we were not sure if because we were using the BOGO she thought we couldn't afford it or that is her normal way of opening. Never the less the food came out pretty promptly after that nice sized portions my selection was good I had the Ragu which was a meat sauce with rigatoni the sauce was not to acidic but not sweet I enjoyed the meal and only ate about half of it and brought the rest home. Now the person I went with she ordered the Al Sugo it had more sauce then pasta literally it was swimming in the sauce she ordered the meatball for the additional $3.00 and for $3.00 you would think she would have received at least 2 or 3 of them since it was on the small size however the menu is specific and says Meatball not Meatballs.

With that said I am not sure i would revisit although my meal was not bad I would have to say had it not been a BOGO I would not have selected this as my first choice for a lunch... lunches to me should be around the $10 mark for the most part unless I am going to an actual 5 star venue!!!

Authentic Italian food- everything we had was fantastic and fresh.  The drinks were excellent and the service was great.  You can tell they really care about the food and their business.  Will definitely make this a regular spot when in town sq.   Beautiful wood stove for the pizzas, nice atmosphere.  Highly recommend!

This restaurant was recommended to us by a clerk at the Stratosphere and he was beyond right about how wonderful this place is.From the bartender,  Jackie, to the drinks to the delicious food to the atmosphere, all amazing.I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone looking for splendid authentic Italian food. Wish they would franchise in San Diego...
Food was great!  Service was excellent - overall great experience.  Kids all ate almost all of their pizza so that says it all right there
Excellent Margherita pizza, we also liked the chicken wings and rotolini. Everything was good, no complaints. Beer was good, service was good as well. Cheers!!
Great night for pizza on the patio! Pizza crust was a little on the salty side but that's just me. Salon our waiter was super chill and fast with our drinks. We will be back again

Great food for the whole family.  A must try is the Sea Bass and Calamari, the pizza's are very good and especially since they are done in that amazing oven.  The desserts are also very good.  Overall I would say that we are going to become regular customers.

A little upscale Italian pizzeria situated within Town Square near all the great shopping and AMC theatre and Gameworks.  Tried their happy hour menu.  The food was served quickly and tasty.  The bartenders were a couple of ladies and served their drinks while engaging in a friendly chat with you. Large TV in the bar area with nice cushioned bar stools.  And plenty of seating in the main dining area as well as outside,  with torch lamps to keep you warm. 
We were finished in time for our movie right next door.

Our experience here was average at best.  We were greeted and seated promptly upon arrival but we quickly asked to change tables when their air conditioner blew gusts of cold air right on top of us.  So stay away from the windowed areas would be my first tip.

We were currently having lunch during happy hour so we ordered the Italian Trio of the limited happy hour menu items.  It consisted of cold dishes of marinated zucchini, sauteed mushrooms, and caponata.  I asked two servers what caponata was and they could not describe it at all.  They said it was "capers, mixed with other things".   I looked it up just now and it's eggplant and celery seasoned usually with sweetened vinegar, capers, in a sweet and sour sauce.  I don't typically like to eat eggplant and I would have not ordered this if I received an accurate description.  The entire dish was okay but the bread that came along with this was hard and difficult to bite.  

My wife and I had the Chef pizza while my daughter had a typical cheese pizza that she enjoyed.  Our Chef pizza was a thin pizza topped with parmesan slices, basil, red cherry tomatoes, olive oil, arugula, parma ham, and buffalo mozzarella and light with the tomato sauce.  While the main portion of the pizza was soft and foldable, towards the crust it was a tough and bland.  The buffalo mozzarella was small, the ham a bit sparse and not consistent among the slices.  An average slice but not quite to par with a cheaper and yet tastier Settebello's. 

Service was friendly.  Attentive, but maybe a tad bit much.  Our server asked us how everything was before we even started to try our food and then asked how everything was twice more within the next 5 minutes.   Maybe that's nitpicking but sometimes I just want to enjoy the company of who I am dining with but with the peace of mind that I can find my server when needed.

Overall, a decent option for pizza in Townsquare to compete with those offered by nearby restaurants.  This is definitely the most authentic 'Italian' style pizza in the area if that is what you are craving for.  

Yelp 100 Challenge 2016 - 30 / 100

Wow!  Legit.  So difficult to find but worth the effort.  My wife and I visited from San Diego and found this place by accident.  AmaEd to find the owners and managers so passionate about their place and to see a pizza oven imported from Naples Italy.  It is gorgeous.  The menu is great and the food very authentic.  Will return every time we are in Vegas.

I gotta say, after reading several positive reviews on here, we were quite disappointed. The service was great, ambiance was very nice, but the food fell short of expectations. My wife and I both ordered the baked ziti, and man were we let down! No ricotta, very skimpy on the mozzarella cheese, and rather dry. 
The garlic bread was pretty much Texas toast that you can buy at your local grocery store. 
My mother ordered a pasta pesto dish with shrimp. The pasta was drowned in oil, and the shrimp were overdone. We did not complain, paid the bill, and left, however, I felt the need to leave an honest review. I love Italian food, but with this underwhelming experience, and so many other choices in Vegas, I highly doubt I'd go back.

In regards to the owners reply...being separate was completely fine with us and was not even an issue.  We were completely fine until we got our food.  Clearly you didn't have any clue what the issue was.  I guess you still don't.  Even after its laid out in front of you in the yelp review, you still had nothing to say about what the real issue was...the food and knowledge of your staff.  Thanks anyway for your reply.
Love it here! Family style restaurant with amazing Italian Pizza, Pasta, and Appetizers! Great prices too!

I came here on Monday afternoon, and since it was happy hour, four of the antipastos were 50% off. The food was great, and our server was attentive and helpful. When we asked her about the menu selections, she was very detailed in explaining. We had the Italian Trio and chicken wings. I absolutely loved the sauce that came with the Italian Trio which reminded me of marinara sauce but way better. This place was pretty quiet when we came, so we didn't have to wait long for our food.
Laurel was great! I want her as my server every time! Food was tasty and fresh. Will be coming back in the near future.
Really good pizza and friendly service, Sloan was our server. Would definitely go back again

We had a great meal here last night. The food, music and atmosphere were beyond fantastic, very authentic food. Our server Mike was very helpful  and gave us great recommendations on food and wine. All around great, we will definitely be back. Ask for Mike when you go.
Great pizza and service!  Enjoyed the rachetta pizza. Had to find it on 2nd floor of Town Square. Will be back.

Great pizza at an extremely reasonable price. Three competitive eaters put away two slices shy of 10 whole pizzas for under $45 dollars. Nice atmosphere with plenty of natural light making its way into the dining room. Salad was perfect and free dessert to boot with Yelp check in. Well worth trying for the all you can eat special 11 to 2p Monday through Friday. Best pizza deal in town!

Back for a 3rd time.Linguine alla Vongole was just wrong.No garlic,no wine....needing a new recipe.Live music on Wednesdays is a great touch.Brought my bottle of Caymus...luckily as their wine list suffers miserably.Still a happy camper anyhow.Hopefully next visit will be better.
Best pizza in Vegas!! Love the Portuguesa- almost as if I was in Brazil eating it. I'm a regular customer and plan on continuing!! Thank you for opening this place!

It takes a lot for me to write a review, but for this place I just had to. After living in Italy for several years I had searched far and wide in the US for authentic Italian pizza. I always got excited when I saw places advertising their authenticity and imported ingredients only to find that it was just an American attempt at Italian style. And then I found this restaurant. It is the closest pizza to Italy's that I have found. It is absolutely amazing, and the employees are super sweet and attentive. I now come here on every Vegas trip. Forget the strip-I'm going here!

Finally!  My kind of pizza in the desert....The pizza just melts in your mouth if that makes any sense.  So delicious, just simply prepared and bursting with flavors.  Settebello and Grimaldi's used to be my favorite but not anymore, this place is the best in Vegas.  I love their lunch special as well where they come around to your table serving a slice of whatever fresh pie that just came out of the oven.
Our second time here! I have been eating in many pizzerias and I can say they have one of the best in town. Amazing service from Erica! Check their happy hour.

They did not accept the Groupon and said I had to purchase it before even walking in. I just wanted to save them money because I think Groupon takes a percentage or something. I will not be back. 

Calamari was oily and Alfredo shrimp was watery and oily also.

I've been waiting to eat here for a while. Finally get time Saturday to have a nice lunch. My Google maps walk was a failed attempt, but located only to see a sign that said " we have no server today and we have no dishwasher will open at 4....." WOW sounds like a terrible place to work had high hopes for this place since my favorite place at Silverado ranch closed. Should of taken picture of sign

Decided to try this place after craving some pizza. We sat out on the patio and it was really nice to look out over town square. We got a "pizza with a tail" called the US open and it was delicious! Only downer was that even though our waiter was nice, we felt like he was rushing us out the door. Initially I thought it was because we showed up an hour before closing but it turns out they closed later. He took my fiancés plate from her while she was still eating and when he brought the check he kept checking every minute to see if we had put our card in yet.

We have been eating out all week while on vacation and this was a great meal to end our trip. The stuffed meatballs, chicken parmigiana and rachetta which is half pizza and half calzone were all awesome! The sauce is divine and true Italian. The staff were very attentive as well.

Always great been here. 
Great place amazing pizza napoletana.
Where are you Adriano?? 
Ci vediamo presto spero.

Them GARLIC PARMESAN WINGS!!
.
