.
This restaurant is located on the second floor in the heart of town square right above coffee bean! The patio looks over the little kids park & the fake green grass area which makes a nice view for people watching. 

The staff here are SUPER FRIENDLY & they do an AMAZING job making sure you are accommodated from the bussers to the bartenders. I would have to say a couple of the times we went to dine in .... the hostesses were the LEAST FRIENDLY like they hated their job & was forced to be there or something =/

The food is HOT & FRESH every time we have eaten there!! Their HAPPY HOUR items are LIMITED but they are sooooooo DERICIOUS! 

LA BELLA FAMOUS CHICKEN WINGS $12.85 - these are also on HAPPY HOUR which I think is only like $7 But they come tossed in parmesan sauce that is just SO ADDICTING!! 

COXINHA TRIO $12.85 - I freaken LOVE this simple deep fried croquette stuffed w/ chicken, veggies, meat & cheese served w/ their special sauce BUT I much prefer it w/ ranch
 
LA BELLA SALAD $9.00 - thin slices of ham w/ buffalo mozzarella, arugula, cherry tomato, mixed greens, basil, candied walnut, olive oil, & balsamic vinegar 

PORCINI PIZZA $14.85 - I may have to say this pizza was LACKING the porcini taste which is what I was desperately CRAVING 

SUPER CARMELA $16.85 - CHEESY overloaded goodness. You can really taste the nice smokyness from the woodfire oven baked into the pizza & the pesto flavor comes out from the stuffed crust!!
  
TIRAMISU $6.95 - OMG the flavors are just POPPIN!! It's not too watery like most places seem to do which I don't like but it was a perfect amount of moisture. 

NUTELLA CALZONE - can't emeber the price for this but it was on a special. It was delicious but I will have to say it is different since it was a lot of dough compared to an actual dessert like a crepe but it was FUN to try!
We loved this place! Really great service, super sweet! Great food! We live in San Francisco but we will be back!
Really disappointing! Although the service was great the food was not. The salad was drenched in dressing, the Gnocchi was fishy tasting.  Go somewhere else like Yard House instead.
Need to stop by this place again. Had the pizza with the handle. I think it was the Miami open. So delicious.

Great food quality.  Great service.  A winner of a place.  One word of interest,  I was in there for lunch the other day and I wanted chicken parm and I noticed it wasn't on the menu but they did have it on a separate menu so if you are looking for chicken parm or chicken piccata, things of that nature see if you can get that other menu.   Great food!!!

Another great restaurant addition to Town Square!

Ordered the Calzoni Funghi La Bella tomato sauce, ricotta, fresh mozzarella, porcini, baked ham, parmesan, olive oil and basil. On point and met my expectations. However, a side of marinara sauce would heave taken it to a 5. I did order it to go and wasn't able to go back for it. 

Service was awesome! Sat at the bar. Quick and friendly service. Also a plus i'm a fan of bulleit rye. From my understanding just recently added to their bar. 

Will absolutely be back! For all the Town Square mall employee's they have a discount.

I came strolling in with my woman for dinner. A nice italian lady pulled me in after convincing me the menu looks better once on a plate on my table. I loved the shrimp & calamari appetizer, as well as the ragu dish. And considering the place was closing, I wasnt rushed at all by the staff. My waitress was prompt and friendly as well. I will definitely be back again.

My coworker suggested this place since we were going to be at Town Square for the annual Cadillac show.   We stopped in for lunch and were seated right away.  The hostess and the server were both attentive and friendly.   My husband and I shared a salad that was very good!  He enjoyed his fettuccini alfredo and I loved my baked ziti!   Next time we will have to try their pizzas since a lot of the reviews are positive!  We decided to sit inside but since we were near the patio we had a nice breeze.  Look forward to coming back--great food, great service!

Tried this place on a whim a couple weeks ago. It was so good we came back 2 weeks later. Very fresh and authentic taste, friendly wait staff, and great wine special. Would recommend to anyone in vegas. Sloan, our server was awesome.

I am giving them one star for greeting and seating us. After 10 minutes no one came to our table and another couple that came after us was waited on before us
 Disappointed and they say this is the best pizza in town but we will mever know.

Throughly enjoyed the food and company. 
Get any outside table and overlook the people enjoying the Town Center. 
Caponata was excellent and I love good caponata. 
Real Italian waiter didn't hurt either. 
Pizza was excellent and the topping choices where better than you get at dominos. 
Great choice when visiting Town Center in Vegas

Wow!  I am so impressed with La Bella Napoli Pizzeria.  During a night of intense Christmas shopping, my friend and I initially planned on going to another restaurant, thank goodness it was crowded,  the other place had a wait time of 40 minutes and it was so loud  on Wednesday night so we decided to skip it and find another place... I Love what the Town Square folks have brought to the Las Vegas community, great shopping, entertainment, and fantastic restaurants!  La Bella is now my "go to" for Sea bass!  The dish is called Branzino and it is a light olive oil based sauce served with capers, olives and cherry tomatoes, man oh my and the buttery, fluffy, flavourful  mashed potatoes were on point!  Our server was Laurel and she was wonderful! The ceaser salad was tasty, with fresh crispy romaine, the Syrah wine was awesome and finally, the bread was light and perfect, tasted fresh made and I enjoyed the balsamic and oil with herbs!  I will definitely return for the fish again but I really want to try some of their other seafood offerings like the al mare and the shrimp diavola. I also might add that my friend and I have very small appetites so we split everything and left stuffed!  I'm sure if I didn't have a salad and bread first I would of easily polished off that sea bass!!  Thank you for a warm, comfortable dining experience!  I alsmost forgot to mention the view!  It was gorgeous especially during the holidays with the Christmas tree and all the lights.
Lastly, if The offer is still available... Check in and you will receive a complimentary glass of wine :-)

I was there tonight we ordered a pizza that came out soggy and dough was raw. We sent it back and the 2nd one came out in less then 5 minutes and was no better. Sauce,was watery when the manager came over she said that's how this pizza is. Thin crust ans supposed to be wet. To me there is a difference between wet and raw.v

Laurell is an amazing server. Great service from her. Makes the whole experience amazing. Foods authentic and amazing. Wine selection is great. Laurell had amazing knowledge on all of it and recommends food and drinks perfectly.

Absolutely delicious! Great service. Geraldo was a great waiter and made great recommendations. 
Had the arugula pizza, tagliatelle pesto with shrimp, a kids cheese pizza, and tiramisu. Everything we ate made us very happy :) The tiramisu was especially amazing!

My one recommendation for the owner would be to dim the lights a bit. It would help the mood to feel a little more relaxed and cozy. :)

Stumbled across this pizza joint while visiting town square and I must say i am so happy we did. Pizza is hands down the best, so much flavor!!! I will definitely be back soon, keep craving the flavor of this pizza. Also, it is not so thick where you feel bloated and nasty after

3.5 Stars.

My first experience at La Bella Napoli Pizzeria was really good, so I decided to bring a group of friends so that they could also give this place a try. I made a reservation for my party and we were seated upon arrival. They have tables inside as well outside on the back patio. The woman working up front was very welcoming and full of smiles as she seated us, but the owner didn't give us the same welcoming vibe. On my first visit he went around to all of the tables saying hello and checking to make sure everything was good including my table where he turned on heat lamps for us since it was a chilly night and we were on the patio. On my second visit he did the same to the other tables, but not ours. Instead the owner stood off to the side glaring at us it was bizarre. One of my friends wanted to change her seat so she wasn't facing him lol. The girl who took our order was very nice however she could have paid better attention when it came to refilling our drinks. 

Italian Trio ($5.42 HH price) - Roasted peppers and sauteed mushrooms with crostini. The peppers and mushrooms were good, but the bread was very hard. It could have broke glass. 

Ciccio Boc ($13.85) - Red tomato sauce, red cherry tomatoes, sliced Parmesan, olive oil, arugula and small mozzarella balls. As if those toppings weren't sounding good enough to me, I noticed this pizza is made with a ricotta stuffed crust, yum! The crust had just the right amount of blistering and the bottom crust held the toppings well. The ricotta stuffed crust tasted really good. This is a pizza I'd order again and recommend to others. 

Quattro Formaggi ($14.85) - Tomato sauce, Mozzarella, Provola, Parmesan and Gorgonzola cheeses. I found the Gorgonzola to be extremely overpowering and it added a strong smokey flavor I just couldn't handle. I'd order this again and adjust the type of cheese they put on it since they weren't shy at all with making the pizza nice and cheesy. The crust was on point also.   

Australian Open aka Rachetta ($17.85) - This pizza is shaped like a tennis racket that is complete with a cheese filled handle. You read that right, cheese filled handle! The handle is filled with Ricotta, Provola and Parmesan. The toppings are red sauce, red cherry tomatoes, arugula, Parmesan, olive oil, basil, Parma ham and mozzarella balls. This pizza is what you should try at least once and they currently have 5 different rachettas to choose from on the menu. The toppings tastes fresh and all complimented each other well. Now the downside.... The pizza was only sliced half way so that 2 pieces could be pulled away and they didn't finish cutting the rest making it a bit hard for us all to get a decent slice without tearing it all apart. The handle absolutely needed more cheese inside it! I was a bit bummed when we cracked open the handle and it was mostly empty with just some cheeses from the pizza outside of the handle that spilled over during baking. 

Dominic Diavola ($13.85) - Tomato sauce, hot coppola, roasted sweet peppers, hot peppers, mozzarella, Parmesan, olive oil and fresh cracked pepper. This is listed in big bold letters on the menu that's it's spicy. While everyone at my table really enjoyed this pizza, most of us found it not to be spicy, but rather have great flavor from the combination of toppings without a huge kick to our taste buds.  

Tiramisu ($8.85) - Decent size and tasted great. Perfect ending to the meal. 

When it came time for the bill I became a bit uncomfortable. We had a Groupon and the server said the owners don't allow her to take the printed paper voucher and can only accept it if you give them your log in and password info for Groupon so they can redeem it that way. That is just ridiculous! No joke this server pulled out her personal cel phone and said to put in my info. I refused to do that and even with the really shitty cel signal at Town Square I was able to get Groupon open on my phone where I told her she can mark it redeemed in front of me there, not on her phone or any other employee. I saw her go over the the owner and talk to him about it, and he seemed not happy, but allowed me to do it that way. Nobody should ever be giving out personal passwords and log in info like that and they shouldn't offer a Groupon if they aren't going to honor it the ways it's intended.  

They have an all you can eat buffet from 11 am - 2 pm on Fridays for $13.85 which is worth checking out. Out on the back patio they have misters in the summertime and heat lamps in the winter. La Bella Napoli Pizzeria is located upstairs in Town Square.

I been in this restaurant 3 times already and they are very consistent with the quality of service and food,my favorites dishes is the coxinhas on the appetizer menu and the delicious pizzas they serve made by the owners in a wood fired oven so amazing.Not Just that,but they serve my favorite drink caipirinha.I been here with my family last Saturday and we will be back soon thank you Adriano and La Bella Napoli staff for the amazing experiente!

I discovered this cool little pizzaria restaurant on one of favorite websites Groupon, but there was not much information online since ut was fairly new. The menu looked enticing and sexy per my reseach and Yelp investigation. We discovered it is located on the 2nd floor (Key Information because it is in a center) in Town Square, directly adjacent to the Blue Martini.

We started off with the Sicilian Chicken Soup which was absolutely flawless and amazing. Perfectly seasoned and full of flavor. We also ordered  Chicken Picatta which was very good. The chicken was great but the noodles could have been a tad more cooked they were a bit to firm but other than that it was perfect sauce and all. The Salmon which Spinach was a little larger than expected and the sauce was Sooooooo good. It was definitely a must order. Perfect texture with an amazing crunch on the edges of the salmon. 

Groupon usually never steers me wrong lol and once again helped me find a gem. Big Shout out to our waitress Mary Lynn (I think that was her name) who was super friendly and helpful. Ask for the Puerto Rican waitress she will talk you death lol but she has a sweet personality and cares about her customers which was much appreciated. I would reccomend sitting outside so you can enjoy the fresh air and view of trees etc. Sorry we didn't try the pizza which was getting all the love in others reviews but I can eat pizza all day back home in NY/NJ lol

I cannot count the number of times weve been comingto this place. This has been our favorite italian restaurant because of the delicious pasta they serve and the outstanding service they provide. My go to meal is the spaghetti with ragu sauce and the canoli. One time they have mistakenly served a rigatoni instead of spaghetti or fettucine and they insisted to correct even when i was okay with the penne pasta. They also got it done in a just a few minutes. Then the manager took care of our dessert which was really not necessary but we thought was excellent of him to have offered as a gesture of keeping customers happy. I have never met one person here who has not gone beyond just asking for our order. The pizza is always good. The serving is a good size and the canoli is wonderful.
La Bella is truly a beautiful find amidst the restaurants of Vegas.   Wood-fired, Italian style pizza and a gluten-free crust that is to die for! Probably some of the best pizza we've ever had.

What a charming and quiet upscale Italian pizzeria on the 2nd level of Town Square!  The interior is very cozy with a small bar, and there is patio seating overlooking the central "park" area in Town Square.  It is also conveniently located near the theater and other eating/bar establishments.  The bar offers a $30.00 beer tower that clocks in at 96 ounces.

We were greeted by the host who recommended the rachetta (racquet shaped pizza) and a few other dishes.  He was super friendly and gave great information on the dishes.  Our server was Jackie.  She was quick, pleasant, and unobtrusive.

We chose the Miami Open rachetta.  It was the perfect size for two people to share.  The food was fresh, delicious, and arrived quickly.  

Based off this singular experience, I will be coming back to try more of their dishes.

We didn't have the pizza so I can't comment on that it did look good though. 

The only reason we went here was because of a $15.00 off deal and even with that it wasn't worth it. 

The ravioli was cold, the meatball was like warm as well. The flavor on both were very bland. 

The rigatoni was also bland, and the meat included with it was very dry. 

The staff was great on the other hand, just the food was in no way there.

Stopped in here for dinner and ordered the Wimbledon. Arrived pretty soggy in the bottom, and pretty burnt on the crust. Didn't taste terrible, but definitely not what I had in mind. Server was friendly and quick.

We wanted a bite before heading to the car-rental return/airport. And we were not wanting to get sucked back into the strip and wanted some Italian. I'd say you can't go wrong by coming here. Service was great, the hostess was very welcoming in telling us about the uniqueness of their rachettas and cuisine as we were getting seated. We had the Miami and Australian open. In hindsight with just 2 of us, we should've shared one and ordered a anti pasta or salad to share. But both rachettas were fine.

I attended a Company Christmas party last night and was issued 2 drink tickets. My date and I do not drink alcohol so I asked if they had anything nonalcoholic. The bartender replied nothing nonalcoholic some I said how about a virgin Bloody Mary. When the bartender returned she said $6 and my drink ticket only included Budweiser and wine. I thought it was ridiculous and felt overcharged for a nonalcoholic drink. Shame on you to force alcohol on people. Will not return to this establishment.

We stumbled upon this place shortly after they opened and fell right in love! 
We come to Town Square quite often and dine at this restaurant frequently. 
Service is always nice, prices are reasonable and food is delicious!!!
They always try to accommodate us when we request to sit on one of their patios because our little one can walk around and not bother anyone. Plus he loves watching his favorite train from the balcony. 
We have not had a bad meal there. 
Keep up the good work!
Yup, Delicious.  Total foodie and might have had the best chicken soup of my life here.  The pepperoni pizza was also delicious.  Great spot in a mall that has a great playground for the little ones.
The atmosphere, the staff, and most of all, the food was awesome. My family and I went there tree nights in a row.

Stopped in after a movie at the AMC on a Saturday after seeing the yelp reviews and while the pizza is good, the service can be hit or miss. Luckily, the pizza maker guy (I forgot his name--Axel maybe?) made up for the hostess and waitress' mistakes at the end with a delicious pizza and rachetta as well as a complimentary strawberry nutella dessert pizza.

Walked in around 3:30 on a Saturday afternoon and there was no hostess or anyone at the front. Walked to the dining area and they seemed somewhat annoyed/surprised to see us. Asked if they were open and if we could sit.

The hostess was lounging on a bench near the bar. When we walked in, she looked like a customer hanging out drinking by the bar and the only reason we realized she was the hostess later was because she moved up front to the hostess station by the time we left.

We placed our order for a rachetta and a pizza. Simple enough, right? We were the only 2 customers / 1 table in the restaurant and our server managed to forget the rachetta somehow. I can't imagine how service would be during even a remotely busy time considering she can miss 1 out of 2 things ordered when you're the only table in the restaurant. We get the pizza pretty quick but after waiting another 15 minutes, it was clear they forgot the rachetta as it didn't look like it was being made...

Went for a friend's bday party, food tasted great but the pizza was soggy and quite frankly looked unappetizing. See pics.

I had to roll my pizza slice into the crust because the bottom was so soggy I couldn't even lift it into my mouth. 

Really disappointing for a $16 pizza.

This place is done up and looks very nice but it's professionally decorated to make up for the mediocre food they serve.

Portions are small, bland, and boring. Way too pricey. Personally won't be coming back.

If you want to impress a date there are other places to go to that give you more bang for your buck with the same ritzy atmosphere.

Hopefully the quality of the dishes improves. I know this place is new and we were at a big group table, so I'm trying to keep that in mind. But this place is not off to a great start. Just FYI.

I actually wanted to leave 0 stars but I couldn't. So my boyfriend and I walked in and got sat on the patio. After sitting down they asked if we could get up. Like wtf. Then after telling us they had no tables inside because they have to save all their opens tables for reservations, they said they could seat us, BUT that was after we said we were going somewhere else. Rude and very unprofessional. Hope they go out of business like all the other crappy places at Town square. Good luck

La Bella Napoli is a very welcome alternative to the industrialized, cheesecake-factoryized version of Italian food that they serve at Brio, just down the fake-street from LBN in Town Square.

Authentic, delicious and welcoming in every way, LBN is making some of the best neapolitan pizza on Las Vegas Blvd (that was for all of you pretend-New Yorkers who think Secret Pizza is the bomb). 

They have a gorgeous pizza oven that was brought in from Napoli and craned up to the second floor, where the restaurant is located, in the middle of the night so as not to disrupt Town Square business. Now that's commitment!!!

The owner and his chef-wife are warm and caring. 
Geraldo, one of the waiters there, is completely dedicated to making your experience a memorable one.

My only issue with this wonderful restaurant is that their wine list is slight. 
I hope that in the future they will address their wine list with as much passion and care as they do their pizza.

My heart and stomach are so full!!

The hostess (owner?) gave us our own patio on a Wednesday evening because we had our pups with us. She was the sweetest! We had this private patio that sat 20 at a table and had patio furniture with our own private tv!

After a long day, traveling 6 hours, in our sweat pants, they took us in and treated us as if we were dressed to impress. We weren't. Lol. We were exhausted, beaten down, and just over the entire day. 

Our waitress was attentive and came to check in on us throughout dinner. She recommended the baked ziti, which we tried. 

The food is OMG! They Boc pizza is a must try and has ricotta stuffed crust. The best part of the pizza is the sauce IMO! It's so light and fresh! But eat the pizza fast because it has a thin crust and will get soggy fast. Baked ziti had a great flavor. Definitely vey filling. Hubby and I killed the pizza and left about 1/5 of the ziti. 

If you check in on Yelp, you get a free Tiramisu dessert!!

So it was mine and my wife's first time trying this interesting concoction called a "racket" (rachetta), where the main part is a standard pizza but the racket "handle" is bread stuffed with cheesy deliciousness. We ordered the "Wimbledon".  To say that we enjoyed it would be an utter understatement.  The ambiance was nice and quiet and a wonderful departure from the craziness of the near-by LV strip (though to be fair, it was a Tuesday night). 
The wine selection was good and not over-priced as some restaurants on the strip might be.  
Our server was amazingly attentive and as a "cherry on top" helped my wife out when she was struggling with loading her Groupon on her phone. 
We had no problem finding parking on the "ring" road but aren't sure how tough it might be on a weekend.
Next time we are in LV, I'm going to try to convince my wife to go back to La Bella Napoli!
A wonderful experience. The staff is very pleasant and the pizzaiolo was happy to talk pizza with me. Truly Neapolitan in flavour and cooking techniques.

Nice, quaint little atmosphere. Standard Italian menu...pastas, pizzas, rachettas etc. 

Service is pretty good and the food is decent. Flavors are a bit bland and understated but it was overall good. 

Wouldn't go out of my way to come back but was an alright experience.

Our dinner included a family of 10 including 3 children.  The staff was wonderful, and very attentive to the whole family.  The pizzas were plentiful, and the spaghetti was a hit with the kids.  The calamari was a hit, even to some 9 year olds who didn't believe what calamari was, or that they liked it.  I loved the combo of a pizza and calzone which comprised the open Miami.

I was craving pizza and have always wanted to eat at Las Bella Napoli, but usually they are always closed. It is not what you think they open at 4 pm. So that usually rules out lunch. We arrived at 5:15 pm and were allowed to seat ourselves. The server/ bartender gall was upbeat and happy. We ordered there version of a pizza that was cheese and one pepperoni. Also, we shared a half Caesar salad. There portion sizes are huge and very authentic tasting.

The atmosphere and the mood of the restaurant is so ambient that it makes one feel like there dining with nature. Even though the ceiling greenery is fake it is done so well and authentic. There prices are about normal and the restroom area has an open sink for all and three or four individual bathrooms with doors that close and lock for our personal bathroom time. The sink has a soft reddish orange that goes well with the green ceiling .

Les pizza sont faites maison et sont très bonnes, ça change des dominos...
Le personnel est très souriant.

Bref, un bon moment :)
Really good food! Happy hour is 3pm-7pm. Get the wings! The pizza is really good and the pasta was perfect!

Ate here for the first time. If you go to town square go here. We ask our waiter Sloan about what their best selling pizza was and he suggested the top 3 on the menu and we got the pimonte pizza. Best pizza I have ever had. Spaghetti my wife ordered was great too. Will definitely be coming back here again.
Amazing Family Run and Owned Operation!!! Amazing food and service is great... one of few spots in Vegas with a great patio.. don't miss happy hour and try one of their Signature Pizzas!!

We dine here , we are Italian and the food here it's not real Italian , sorry but the linguine alle vongole it's not like Italian dish!!! So salty and a lot of broth. And a lot of spicy.... the service is nice ... the pizza it's gummy and without flavor.

Well unfortunately I cant give one of my favorite spots for wings and pizza 5 stars.  Have to take off 2 stars due to the bad service. 
I have been here several times ( I am a local) and always enjoy the happy hour wings actually being a local I must admit these are the best wings in town. Also they have pretty good pizza too. Service at a restaurant is #1 in my point of view. Without good service and only good food its like a pretty face with no teeth...lol best way I can describe it. Good service is an absolute MUST. Makes the whole point of going out to eat worth it. Otherwise if I want just good food I can stay home and cook for that. My family and I had horrible service but an amazing meal. If only we could tip the chef. Gerardo (our server) seemed rushed, uninterested in being there, and had zero personality. Guests at resturants want to at least feel welcomed. Don't get me wrong maybe he had a bad day or had personal stuff going on, but don't bring your issues to work with you and give people that are spending money and helping to pay your bills bad service. Ever! My husband is in the hospitality industry in town which makes it that he is aware that good service is highly important. Good service deserves good tips. I wish I didn't have to leave a review like this cause I love Napoli's but if someone doesn't point things out in businesses thats how things go unnoticed and never fixed. Thank you Napoli for the amazing food. I really hope next time we come service is just as amazing as the food.

This place gets 5 stars because I can't rate them at 6!!! 

Clean, nicely decorated, balanced menu, affordable prices, great location and really good food. Marie Ann was my waitress, she has a great personality and charisma. She made me enjoy my meal even more. 

The chicken soup was delicious, and so was the chicken parmigiana, very light but with great flavor. The iced tea is really good, flavorful and freshly brewed. 

The best part was that I needed to print email, I asked Marie Ann if she could help, she talked to yeh owner of the restaurant, who was having lunch at that precise moment, his name is Adriano, who was kind enough to pause his lunch so he can print my email. This type of customer service is priceless. 

Great job!!! Keep yo the good work, I will visit you in my next trip to Las Vegas.

My wife and I love this place so much. Fantastic food, great service and wonderful ambiance. This is our go-to authentic Italian place. One negative, which is hard for us to swallow, they aren't open for lunch during the week anymore! We used to come here for lunch regularly but they have changed their schedule and are only open for lunch on weekends. We hope they are doing well on the weekends, even though we miss going on the weekdays!

Such friendly staff and great pizza.  They're upstairs across the movie theaters... easy to get to.
I love this place.

I loved this place. It's a little small inside but I have to admit the decor and outside patio is what got me. It's tucked away in town square, upstairs across from blue martini. Wood fired pizza and a small selection of appetizers and desserts plus a full bar. The food was delicious and the bartender was very sweet and accommodating. She also was sure to
Mention their happy hour which I'll be back try in the future. We ordered this pizza...I'm not sure what it was called but it was like the crust was pulled to an end and stuffed with cheese, topped with lots of pepperoni, then cooked in the wood fired oven. SO YUMMY. I highly recommend this place I'm not sure if it's new or just hidden. Super cute date night spot especially with the weather getting better for the beautiful patio.

Tonight was my second chance for Napoli and it was the same poor experience as the first time. This time, the bartender was terrible. He happened to be our server last time too so I think it might be a personal problem. My girlfriend ordered an old-fashioned and our server brought her a red Manhattan martini. The description on the menu even reads "over ice." There was no orange peel.. No ice. At one point out of nowhere, the bartender rudely comes over, stands behind my friend and interrupts our experience saying: I'm the bartender here, did you order a Manhattan or an old-fashioned? We said old-fashioned, he said well that's an old-fashioned... Well, Mr. Bartender (would call you by name, but you were too rude to introduce yourself), that was NOT an old-fashioned and you are consistently unpleasant. Napoli doesn't have the authentic Italian vibe we were hoping for and it's a shame especially because I love Italian food, culture and people.
First time at La Bella.  Very satisfied.  Tried a few items and all delicious!
A perfect restaurant - fantastic food, service, ambiance, and location (near the cinema in Town Square.) Also, the best mixologist around...Paulo, and the greatest manager, Bea!!!

Caught the ad for spooky drinks on Facebook so the wife and I got ready and headed down here for some drinks since we don't have kids. Tried a couple spooky Halloween drinks. Delicious however bummed there wasn't much dry ice left. Maybe have lots of dry ice available for the holiday if you're going to promote smokey drinks. We sat at the bar and our bartender was very nice and personable. We had wings which were good and a few drinks to celebrate Halloween. Service was great and food/drinks were good. I recommend and will definitely be back for the pizza next (:

Great food! Great service, Jason (our server) was awesome! The chicken wings with Italian sauce were finger licking good. The Rachetta was stuffed with heavenly cheese, and the Nutella pizza was amazing.
Delicious discovery ! I tried calzoni and my friend raqueta and it was so good !!! Fresh ingredients and homemade pizza ! Service was friendly and employees with smile.

The food and atmosphere were nothing less than FABULOUS!!!!  We had the Quattro Fomaggi Pizza and the flavor was just great.  The dough is out of this world.  I was told that all of their ingredients come from Italy and you could tell.  Then add the fantastic dinner music and you have one wonderful dining experience.  Don't miss it We can't wait to go back!!!

The service was great. The food came out super fast. The place was really cute. We sat inside because it was getting a little chilly...but the outside patio looked super cute. Food was good and our kids loved the pizza. I had the baked ziti. It was delicious. We will definitely go back.

Came here for dinner with friends, party of 9 including 2 toddlers and 2 little boys. We were seated immediately except the Maitre D already seemed extremely annoyed. Made reservations considering it's a holiday weekend and we were about to dine with a large group. Her face and demeanor was utterly bothersome though. Luckily the food and service made up for what the front person lacked.

A decent spot to grab a casual dinner at Town Square. I had heard mixed things about this spot, but we enjoyed our lunch here.

The restaurant was easy to get into for a weekend lunch. We were seated right away and the service was quick. The inside of the restaurant wasn't very big, but it was cute and comfortable. The outdoor patio looked like a nice spot to enjoy a meal.

I had the Dominic Diavola pizza and really enjoyed it. I loved the flavors and the ingredients tasted fresh. The thin crust was good. My husband had the Miami Open Rachetta. I'd definitely order a rachetta next time. It was like a pizza with a cheese filled breadstick on the end. Very good! Both items were sized to feed one hungry person or to share between two people with an appetizer or salad. 

The menu is huge and includes more than just pizza. They also offer plenty of pasta dishes, salads, calzones, and other entrees. Everyone should find something they'll enjoy here.

EASY 5 stars for the wood-fired pizza. Casual atmosphere, away from the noise of the strip.  Nice open air seating in back,  the pizza beats anything on the strip, maybe in the city! On par with the best wood-fired thin crust margherita pizza I've had anywhere.  Fantastic,  I'd bring all my friends, especially the discerning ones, in a heartbeat!

First time cusomter , was leaving the mall and saw the sign for pizza. Called the restaurant and Becka answered, took my order right away and was spot on with her time commitment. Thank you for great service and pizza. 

Rich
Pizza was amazing, and the waitstaff were very friendly and helpful with all the different types of pizza they offer. Go for the all you can eat pizza lunch, 110% worth it!

I loved the pizza here.
We asked them to do well done and it was perfectly made.
Wish they had more vegetarian options.
good service, good food! Although the menu name and the food description were a little confusing. I would still recommend this place. Nice view too!

Wow. I don't think I have ever been treated so well, ever! I felt right at home as soon as I entered the door. I didn't even plan on eating (just wanted to check out their view which is wonderful), but the service was so fantastic I had to sit down and order something!!! Try the lemonade, they
 hand squeeze it, probably the most delicious lemonade I've ever had!!! Guys THEY GET THEY'RE CHEESE FROM WATER BUFFALOS!!! Haha and it tastes phenomenal. Absolutely fantastic restaurant.

I've only been here one time during lunch. I ordered the $12.50 pizza buffet which was exceptional. I'm a huge fan of woodfire pizza and was blown away by the creative selections they had hot and ready. It's definitely worth stopping by if you're in the area!
Wonderful service and food. I took a lunch group (14) today and they knocked it out of the park. We will be back! Thank you La Bella for a wonderful lunch. My compliments to the Chef.

From San Diego visiting Las Vegas. Our family of 7 was able to dine at La Bella Napoli in November 2017. Parking was a little tricky due to meters not working and we weren't sure if we should just park and risk a ticket, parked any way and (no ticket). 
We sat out on the Patio, which was absolutely lovely. From the start we had great service and our appetizers and dinner was perfect and delicious. Thank you so much, we WILL be back :)

GREAT RESTAURANT!! I ordered the baked ziti and the first bite I took I noticed there was meat in it, and I am a vegetarian. I told my waitress and she immediately took it back and new one came out without meat within 5 minutes! The manager even came up and brought me the pasta. The customer service is amazing at this restaurant and so is the food! Some of the best baked ziti I have ever had, my date had the pesto with chicken and devoured it because it was so delicious!! I am new to Las Vegas and I will most definitely be coming back more often. If you are look for Italian and are having a toss up, choose this restaurant!

I have never left a one star review but this is the worst take out I have ever had. Maybe it would have been better inside but Togo was awful. 

Chicken fingers were beyond burned actually inedible (like breaded chicken jerky) and it was child's meal which was accompanied by half cooked soggy fries. I ordered the chicken soup and it was more like veggie water. Only a couple shreds of chicken and no ditilini pasta (which it says it has on the menu) at all in the soup. So disappointed was hoping to have a great place to refer to friends and clients but now I know where to tell them to steer clear from.

Stopped by here before work to get lunch/dinner and felt like trying out their pasta...

Ordered the Baked Zitti and the Funghi Procini. 

Zitti was warm and cheesy! Porcini is filled with mountains of mushrooms and has an jnyersteing flavor which isn't mundane at all.

Service was adequate and eating outside upstairs was very pleasant.

Food was good BUT we ordered the baked Zita which was very tasty, but it was served luke warm ! Sent it back to warm it up, but after a second try, it came back cool again, not hot! Told our server about it and he offered to make us something else but at this point we were over it! I really expected to have some type of "compensation" for their mistake like a comped dessert or r glass of wine comped but that never happened. As business people we decided to talk to the manager as we felt they should have done something to make it right, but he didn't. He gave us a coupon for a free tiramisu for r next visit. Not real good customer service I would say!

I read a lot of good and bad reviews before coming here.  I wasn't expecting a lot coming here.  Just hoping no cold pizza or super soggy pizza.  In Italy, pizza are on the soggy side.  

We came here around 8pm on Monday.  Not to busy.  There was one server, she was nice and helpful with the menu.  Husband ordered the Capricciosa pizza ($16.85) added egg ($2.00) on top and I got the Miami Open ($16.85).  Both were delicious and the wood fired bake was as expected.  The only thing I would suggest is in the Miami Open's handle should be made with less ricotta cheese.  It wasn't so creamy, it's a weird chunks, in my opinion.

Went there last night & had the diavala pizza, it was pretty good,  I wasn't a big fan of the thin ham but it was still good, to each their own.  Bartender was very sweet & she was really nice as well.  It is a smaller place, when I walked by I thought it was takeout only.  I'd go back.

I had this opportunity to try something new today, invited to try the Rachetta with the Australian Open option, a really good pie half calzone half pizza subtly decadent very tasty. I also explored the La belle salad very tasty and a meal within itself. I also enjoyed their classic cherry coke, with the maraschino cherry it topped off an excellent meal.

The staff was excellent very kind and much character. I appreciate good food service and an excellent facility. A little hard to find on the 2nd floor though not an inconvenient location perching you up in a nice vista of other shops and beautiful semi desert decorum.

I hope you check it out the menu has a number of entree for the serious diner.

Very good and tasty thin crust brick oven pizza with a slight char. The tomato basil soup was great. Kids meals were large portion and high quality.  
My only complaint is on some of their prices: all of their appetizers, bowls of soup $10, simple chicken parm $23, pint of draft Bud $7, and they charge $3 for kids drinks. 
I'm sure they're in the market for tourist pricing but not necessarily for repeat local visits.

Did the all you can eat lunch a few months back. This is one of the best pizza's I've ever had in my life! 

For some reason it took a while for the first pizza's to start rolling in (15 minutes from time we ordered) even though it's served Brazilian style and they are always cooking during lunch. Not long enough to ding a star. All the pizzas had super unique flavors, some were certainly more hit than others. I seem to recall one going around the restaurant a couple times with few takers.

Very nice ambiance and service as well!
Outstanding food and service. I will return!  Pizza is really authentic.  But still has an American touch.  Perfect.  Veal Marsala was very good and the portion is perfect to share.
Pizza dough is really good ! This is the best ever pizza I have ever tried!  I am so lucky to have this place!! Definitely I will come back !!

This is probably my least favorite place at town square. The food was not great and the service was awful. We will not be back. This  the second time and it has been the same both times. Napoli does not give bread unless you ask. The salad was boring. Go to Brio instead.

If you are looking for amazing service, fantastic food and love to support locally family owed business this is the place. Too affordable for the service and food!! Top notch!!! Highly recommend them!!
Loved our meal at Napoli. The fettuccini alfredo was delicious. So was the pizza and salad. Kids gave it 5 stars. Sloan did a great job.
My boyfriend and I happened to stop in here before seeing a movie one night. So glad we did. We received great service and the pizza was delicious as well. Great Italian style pizza.
We love this place.  Great service Laurel was great. Food was fanastic. Welcoming and friendly.  We will return.

1st. Fast sitting and greeted right away by our server JAMIE.. 
2nd. Food order came fast. JAMIE always make sure we have everything. 
3rd. Food. We ordered pizza, pasta and meatball appetizer. 
PIZZA not our liking
PASTA cheesy but a lil salt can help the taste
MEATBALL yes yes yes really tender and tasty.
4th.  PRICE maybe a lil over priced compare to GRIMALDIS. ( i will choose GRIMALDIS WHEN IT COMES TO PIZZA) 
OVER ALL RATING IS AVERAGE. Not so bad.
Ordered to go...pizza was okay, salad was rusty amd uneatable.  Called to ask for a refund, manager was too busy to talk to us...will never go back, gave them a chance.
Nice happy hour domestic beers 3.50 plus yummy super cheesy breads. Not liking the viniger in the olive oil.

This is a five star review for a five star quality restaurant. My boyfriend and I visited the Townsquare Mall for the first time the other night. Trying to decied where to eat was tricky because we didn't know our way around. We stumbled upon "a pizza place" for a casual eat and to our surpise had the best pizza in Vegas! We were greated by a lovely hostess and two very friendly waitresses. The pulled up a heater for us to sit outside. From where we sat we got a beautiful view of the Christmas tree and Santa's house! They let us taste two different sangria specials. The pear one was to die for!!!! I would go back soley for another glass of that. But the pizza, was hands down the best I've ever had. The sauce was unlike any other (brought in from Italy) and the crust was perfect. I could've have gone back for breakfast the next morning. Rachael our waitress was awesome and super personable. We cannot wait to go back! A casual, quick dinner turned into a romantic and outstanding evening.
We came back for the Branzino. This dish is off the hook. Probably the most expensive dish on tje menu but well worth it. A must try.

We had a good time. Tried the ayce pizza and salad. The salad was fantastic. The thin crust pizza was great and since Noone else in the place was doing ayce we got the whole pie and they weren't concerned if we didn't eat it all. The people are very nice. Don't forget check in for free dessert. Yums

I don't think a lot of people know that there is an all you can eat pizza for lunch special for $13.99 which is a good deal if you have a big appetite. How it works is you get to choose a house salad which is a balsamic vinaigrette with mozzarella and prosciutto or a Caesar salad. The salad is only one time then you get a whole pizza half pepperoni and half margarita. After that they bring around slices of 3 different pizza and you can grab as many slices as you want. The service was excellent, two waitresses that helped us worked so well as a team and treated us very well. The pizza are pretty good, traditional wood burning Italian pizza using 00 flour. Crispy and light airy crust. 

It's also a beautiful restaurant a nice place to take a date. Has indoor and outside seating.

Service/employees excellent. Very friendly and attentive.

Décor/Atmosphere: excellent. They also have a patio.

Pizza: Could be better, thus the 3 stars. I used to own a restaurant and was a pizza cook. My pizza was 10x better. Toppings here were good and homemade, but the pizza crust was all greasy and soft and fell apart. Also very bland no taste.

We have done Christmas and Santa on the patio each year, at town square, at what was our favorite pizza spot, with all our friends. We booked a year in advance for this year. A week ago we were informed that they had sold our reservations to a party that was paying per person. Fine--but the kicker is they didn't give us an option to accept or decline this option. As a business owner, i understand that it's hard not to follow the money, but give the first party the option. It's unacceptable and one week before Santa. My kids were looking forward to this night forever and we will never be returning to this place. I will tell everyone this and i will never return to this restaurant. This is horrible customer service and rude.

I had to repeatedly call until someone answered to locate the business as it is in a large center.
After seating I ordered for us.  We received our waters but after 20 minutes still had not received our Peronis.
We told our server. After a few minutes our Beers were delivered to the table across from us. The patrons looked at each other and said did we order these? Upon which they immediately drank.  The server had left so we continued to wait.  Finally a server came by and I cancelled the beers.  The Pizza was warm and looked as thought it had been sitting for a while.
I used the restroom to find urine all over the toilet seat as well as the toilet not flushing.  There were other issues but think this is more than enough to comment on.

Came here with my in laws who were visiting from out of town. Food was ok, but not as good as we were expecting. Setebello in Green Valley has much better pizza in my opinion. My mother in law ordered the baked ziti which came highly recommended by our server (very nice young guy, can't remember his name) when she got it, she shared some with me. Just as I was ready to take a bite, I noticed there was meat in it. To make absolutely sure, I asked the waiter if it contained meat, since nowhere in the menu description did it mention any type of meat. He said he wasn't sure (???) and would go check. He came back and confirmed that yes, it does have meat. As a vegetarian, this was highly disappointing for me. Also, my mother in law is on a special diet where she is supposed to avoid most meats. I do not understand why this wasn't listed on the menu. Our server and the rest of the staff were all very pleasant but I don't think we will return anytime soon.

A friend recommended this place and we were glad we tried it for an early dinner on a Thursday around 5pm. For the appetizer, we ordered the Italian Trio (sauce and mushroom was good, but I didn't really like the caponata), the wings were really good and the Porcini pizza was fantastic!

As soon as I walked inside, I felt the amazing energy going around. Everyone there was so nice and greeted us with a smile! Our waitress was so helpful and good with us. Now let me tell you about the food, it was the most amazing thing that went into my mouth! Everything was made by scratch and you could've tasted it too. I'm definitely coming back here once I go back to Las Vegas!

Great place in Town Square to get some good Italian food. Pizza and pasta is great. Their desserts are delicious. The entrance is a little tucked away that it makes it hard to find but worth the find in my opinion.

First time here and we really enjoyed it.  Linda had the branzino and I had short ribs and parpadelle.   Really liked mine!  Staff was good, service was good and the atmosphere was great!  Will definitely go back.

After a friend recommendation I decided to try this place. The ambiance is nice, quiet, perfect to us, two couples and a babe. In our table we order the fungui calzoni, australian rachetta, grilled rib eye and a pasta. The portions size are good, it leaves no space for dessert. We liked the place and location. The owners and waitress were super friendly. The food is delicious as well as the tiramisu . From now on, this is my preferred pizza place in Vegas.

HIDDEN TREASURE AT TOWN SQUARE. I got to town square A LOT and have never heard of this place or would normally consider it. BUT I went here for my cousins birthday they gave us great service. We were seated right away. There was live music and the whole staff was just so friendly!!! The food was great my favorite thing was their chicken wings. I would definitely come back with a date lol. Definitely recommend if you ever get tired of claim jumper and cpk.
Great place! Classic Napoli pizza, real oven, tastes good. Nice sweet place. nice view. great overall feeling

For those not from Las Vegas the place is in the Town Square close to the movie theater and other restaurants. Normally I would send the pizza that they brought out back to the kitchen, but I was very hungry and decided to just eat it. The "buffalo mozzarella" on my pizza was cold and was added on after the pizza was baked.. don't know why exactly ?? The service needs major work. There was a check in offer that they honored but didn't honor the happy hour prices for the beer that was mentioned to us when we first ordered.

Also I was charged $4 for "buffalo mozzarella" that I think was just regular mozzarella that normally comes with that pizza anyway. (See Tommy P's Pizza)There were a few other things that I don't care to go into detail about, but the solid 2 stars is a fair and honest rating that this place deserves. This place has lots of potential but these major issues that I mentioned earn it 2 lousy stars. I wanted to give one star but the espresso and tiramisu saved the day. I don't recommend this place.

Wonderful place! Super friendly hostess (the owner's mother, I later found out) and the food is amazing! Italians are super picky about Italian restaurants but my husband thought it was great. The pizzas with "handles" stuffed with ricotta are delicious. The bubbled crust with a few blackened spots could only come from a wood-fired oven and we love it! Asparagus soup is delightful and the baked Ziti had a surprising tartness but was wonderful. Nutella calzone with bananas and strawberries is NOT to be missed. Totally recommend La Bella Napoli!!

My husband and I were on the way to Yard House but decided to check out this place since we heard some good live music coming from their patio. 

First of all, all their staffs are sooooo nice. We were greeted by this nice lady at the front door, and served by this friendly waitress who checked on our table regularly. We didn't have to look around one time to find server because they came just right at the time when we needed. 

We ordered baked ziti and this pizza called... don't remember the name but with ham. Baked ziti was perfectly cooked with right amount of sauces and meat. The pizza dough was great that I finished the outer part. I only eat those at Five50 and Grimaldi's but this is an addition to my list. I think that part of the pizza is called cornicione (?). Any ways... 

Here is another highlight. The musician was great! He sang for me, little kids at other tables, and more. Everyone seemed to enjoy. I love live music!! I don't know what days or time he's singing tho... maybe I was lucky. 

Inside is cute and cozy and I felt really comfortable. I will definitely come back for the live music with a glass of wine and Italian food at the nice patio when I'm at the Town Square. No need to go to loud places to grab some drinks at the Town Square.
Great food with fresh ingredients -and excellence service. Grab a patio spot, a beverage and enjoy. We will definitely return.

The food was pretty good. We got the porcini pizza, which the waitress recommended. She also recommended getting the marinara sauce with the pizza to use as a dipping sauce, so we agreed. This was our first time at this restaurant, so I'm not sure how it normally is on a Friday night, but the food took exceptionally slow this Friday night. I think we waited about 40 minutes for our one pizza to arrive. That was a negative, along with what seemed like the waitress's obvious attempts to try to make us order more. Anyway, the pizza was pretty good. It didn't have sauce, so I see why the waitress suggested the sauce, though I didn't expect the $3 charge for the sauce. I'd try this place again to give them another shot, but won't come back again after that if service is slow again.

I went there to purchase some canolli's the place was quite empty and the women's bathroom smelled awful.
When I walked in I thought hmmm I bet these are going to be delicious but when I received them , what I got was waffle  crisps with a side order of vanilla creme.not really worth $20 very disappointing ..
My suggestion is try the next place over

If you're around TownSquare, you're craving good Italian food, and you want to be seated immediately on those busy weekend nights, this is the place for you! Here's the lowdown ~

SERVICE: 4/5
Some servers are more knowledgable than others, and one in particular was just plain forgetful. But they have always, always been super friendly.

AMBIANCE: 5/5
I looove the ambiance of this place. Definitely recommend the patio in good weather, and I always appreciate the twinkly lights and that moood lighting during dinner. Perfect place for date night or a lunch date!

FOOD: 4/5

Pastas I've tried ranked from best to meh:

1) Fettuccine Alfredo with shrimp: 5/5
- perfectly creamy and cheesy
- pasta really shines through in this dish

2) Funghi Porcini: 4/5
- for mushroom lovers
- heavy on the cheese, BUT
- the tagliatelle is awesome

3) Linguini alle Vongole: 3.5/5
- for garlic lovers
- if you're in the mood for seafood
- if you want to avoid cream, but don't mind butter/oil
- pasta isn't really the star in this dish

Pizzas: 4/5
I've tried the Margherita and the Super Carmela. Both pizzas use quality ingredients, have a great crust, and solid tasty flavors.

Tiramisu: 4/5 
Definitely recommend for all the coffee lovers out there.


OVERALL: 4/5
Overall, I definitely recommend this place if you're around the area and craving fresh pasta or good pizza. This place is relatively new, so I've never had to wait to be seated. But I totally would (and I'll eventually have to) because the food is too good not to.

Updated Review:  
I had a feeling I just ordered the wrong thing.  This time I went back and got a dish as well as a pizza and I have to say, they knocked it out of the park.  The service was even better this time and they made you feel like family.  Definitely the gem of Las Vegas.  The food was great, the pizza definitely stayed together better, and the sauce was great.  

Original Review - 3 stars:
Great location upstairs and great atmosphere.  The pizza I ordered... was not a fan, but I would definitely like to come back and try one of the dishes there.  Service was excellent and I really enjoyed my time spent there.  Not a fan of pizzas that are thinner than NY style but the staff was very friendly and made me want to come back another time.  I'll update my review when that happens.

The restaurant in a bit difficult to find, but worth the search. Our table had a good variety of food. The tomato basil soup was delicious. The crust on the pizza and calzone was crispy but chewy. Really delicious. We had a pesto pasta which was also very good.  The service was attentive. We will definitely return.
